paper.title: 2D Projection Interval Relationships: A Symbolic Representation of Spatial Relationships
paper.venue: SSD '95 Proceedings of the 4th International Symposium on Advances in Spatial Databases
paper.abstract: Spatial relationships are important ingredients for expressing constraints in retrieval systems for spatial databases. In this paper we propose a unified representation of spatial relationships, 2D Projection Interval Relationships (2D-PIR), that integrates both directional and topological relationships. We propose a graph representation for pictures that is based on 2D-PIR. This graph representation can be constructed efficiently and leads to an efficient algorithm for “picture matching”.
